name: raccoon
text: A comment left by raccoon was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by wildcat, subtlet, Connellingus, littlefatdog, Archon_Divinus)

name: saint
text: have YOU forgiven Orson Welles?

name: gazdatronik
text: A comment left by gazdatronik was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Vondicus, envika, stop)

name: nice-on-water
text: Fucking "War of the Worlds"...

name: i_love_kate
text: I set fire to my livestock at the first mention of intergalactic immigants. So no.

name: tekende
text: Oh, come on, it's not Orson's fault that people are stupid and easily frightened.

name: eviljoe
text: Good thing they added the key or else I would be very much confused by the poll.

name: pogo
text: A nickel to the first youngin' to identify the woman on the cover.

name: doc_rostov
text:
Eleanor Roosevelt.

You best adjust that nickel for inflation, brosevelt.

name: pogo
text: Okay, make it fitty-cents.

name: mattylite
text: Brosevelt.  God damn, every time I think every bro-able word has been bro'd, I hear a new one, and I swear to god, I always think it's hilarious.  What is this weakness in a dude?  Anyhow, chubbied.

name: heccibiggs
text: I have to say, I completely agree on the hilarity factor. But I don't know that many. ENLIGHTEN ME PLEASE DOGGS.

name: mattylite
text:
Just off the top of my head right when I woke up:
Broseph, Broscious, Brosephus, Brobler,
Brodacious Bra-Bras, James Brolin, Brotisserie, Brotator cuff, Sir Broland, Friends and Bromans, Brolaids, Broget's thesauraus, Brogain, Brose (like jose but w/ bro), Achilles' Elbro, broner, Hasbro, OH CHRIST GOTTA GO TO SCHOOL NOW

name: heccibiggs
text: Many thanks. Will be using.

name: zem
text: my personal favorite is bro-magnon

name: dusty
text: Bro-nan the barbarian, though bro-nan could be a reference to Onan, which I guess could work if you caught your bro jacking it. Like "Hey bro-nan, when you're done in there we gotta get to sosh class, there's a test today"

name: mangtastic
text: Little Bro Peep

name: vondicus
text: Broceidon, Lord of the Brocean. Don't thank me, thank The Onion! And Anarchy.

name: homepie
text: Brosef Stalin, who will liberate the means of broduction from the greedy brogeoisie and give it to the broletariat.

name: mattylite
text: REMEMBER, BROLETARIANS!

name: mattylite
text: Well now this has reached the apex.

name: miku224
text: Broba Fett.

name: teezee
text:
Hybrothetical question:

There is a crossroads with a 30-pack of natty light in the center.

The theme to Bronanza is being played on a fiddle by Brozlebub.

Brozymandias, Abroham Lincoln, Brothello, and Don Quibrote are at each of the roads.

Which bro gets the 30-pack?

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Natty anything goes to Brah Brob Marley by default.

name: rayj3rd
text: And for all of the GLBT fans of Achewood, we must not forget Bromosexual.

name: pogo
text: Nice to see you again, Ms. heccibiggs.  Thought we doggs had chased you out for good.

name: heccibiggs
text: Don't expect to see me on the current strip's comments any time soon.

name: doc_rostov
text:
Congratulations. You are now Assetbar Elite, heccibiggs. Shuffling through the archives like it's nobody's business, communicating through the Distant Past. All using a telegraph machine to write your posts. All of them.

(Okay, only Pogo and I actually do that last one. You're still elite, though.)

name: soticoto
text:
... Was Doc Rostov just a dick to you in the most half-arsed of manners?

He gives a bad name to dicks everywhere.

name: i_love_kate
text: Soticoto! It is sad that you do not understand Basic Human Interactions, but rather than commenting on your misapprehensions all of the time maybe you should consider just observing quietly for a while, at least until you can make a good attempt at emulating okay guys like the rest of us. Maybe? Consider it for me, dude.

name: fancyrat
text: You sound like a real-life Mr. Bear.

name: sidd2600
text: Reminisce magazine has to be the most depressing thing I've ever seen, and since it's normally found at hospices this is not a good thing.

name: tellumo
text: I know! I saw a copy at the nursing home where my grandfather was living shortly before he died. I was really surprised--I thought it was just something Onstad made up!

name: petro
text: Insult is literally added to injury when your friendly local ER only has "Reminisce" and the large-print editon of "Readers' Digest"

name: noah
text: Wow; I didn't realize.  I thought he was making fun of Reader's Digest...

name: honesttom
text:
Yep. They even have a website. Apparently today's bobbins are different from the ones we used to get.
http://www.reminisce.com/Default.asp?r_d=y

name: spinynorman
text:
Why the fuck does "Dave" have the nickname "Stu"

I am incensed by something so asinine

Incensed

name: kelsotimebomb
text:
Prepare to be even MORE incensed, then.

I know a guy named "Jeff" but his nickname is "Earl."

name: foetus_punch
text:
My name is Oliver, but my nickname is Olly! Wait...that's perfectly reasonable.

Okay, from now on I am "Duke of Teacup Land".

name: tfaironpirate
text: My nickname is Zimbabwe, it was given to me by a group of young mostly Caucasian males who thought me to be the "whiter" than average. Ironically of course. Then a family bible was discovered by yours truly and I found out that I descend from African roots. Suddenly the white boys calling me the country from Africa looked to be fools.

name: greenkoolayd
text: his middle name is stuart.  get a grip.  dayum.  im calld tony, but my first name is joseph.  you wanna fight about it?

name: scifigrl47
text: My grandfather's name is Richard.  Everyone calls him Babe.  He says he doesn't know why, so the story must be fantastic.

name: fidget
text:
[IMGS OFF]

sorry it's blurry. also, i hope this works.

name: mikeleffel2
text: Orson Welles would've made one heck of a Mr. Bear voice, all hollerin' about butts at the dinner table and such.

name: stuart
text: There was a similar poll on Starwars.com not too long ago, except it was Annie Hall instead of Orson Welles.

name: molesticide
text: what?  annie hall is a movie orson welles is a PERSON.  i do not understand.

name: morypcaina
text: Annie Hall won Best Picture Oscar for 1977 -- instead of Star Wars, some would say.

name: farqussus
text: some would also say they had the force.

name: tekende
text: I highly doubt Star Wars was even nominated. But I'm too lazy to check.

name: relaxing
text: You would be highly wrong.

name: dusty
text: You can be wrong to doubt, but can a doubt be wrong? It isn't an assertion.

name: relaxing
text: His doubt would be highly unfounded.

name: fineoakstructure
text: The idea of Star Wars winning Best Picture at all, let alone over Annie Hall (a movie that actually deserves to be called a "best picture," unlike many Oscar winners), makes me want to vomit in horror.

name: ford
text: A comment left by ford was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Afterward, StagnantDisplay, Zem, cailetshadow, Boredom_Man)

name: fineoakstructure
text:
You know how many times I've seen Star Wars? I first saw it shortly after I was born. I can recite fucking R2D2's lines, you fuck. .

But Star Wars is not a better movie than Annie Hall. It's a fun action movie enjoyed best as a child...there, I said it.

Many Oscar winners have explosions. And Annie Hall is often considered a comedy.

name: aliiis
text: chubbied for truth

name: boredom_man
text: A comment left by boredom_man was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by relaxing, ford, Satyr)

name: tekende
text: Even if it was George Lucas, I mean, who's gonna listen to anything he has to say anymore?

name: boredom_man
text: I don't want to reply "Marshall McLuhan," but you've forced my hand.

name: heccibiggs
text: For a minute I thought you were being George Lucas addressing Harrison Ford.

name: boredom_man
text: That would be 73% more awesome, yes.

name: tekende
text:
And Harrison would be all like "Yeah, well, have you noticed that all of your movies that don't have me in them suck balls?"

And then a chorus of stormtroopers goes "Ohhhh SNAP!"

name: dusty
text: Is he talking to ford the assetbar user or Harrison Ford?

name: catachresis
text: "Chicken In The Basement (Do-Fi-Dum)" is one of my favourite things ever.

name: agentstinky
text: "I Must Love You, 'Cause I Sure Don't Like You, Marie" is EATING into my fucking BRAIN.  I keep hearing it read, over and over again, by this retarded-sounding hick voice.  I HATE YOU ONSTAD FOR BEING SO ACCURATE.

name: tekende
text: I think Onstad might have been watching Everybody Loves Raymond when he thought of that one.

name: greenkoolayd
text: chubbed.(rays wife is one of the only women ive ever wanted to punch in the face.  and shes imaginary...)

name: tekende
text: Yeah, she can be extremely unlikeable. And the fact that I, a viewer, am expected to symapthize with her most of the time makes me dislike her even more.

name: chaesar
text: Man I had a real bad case of summer complaint one year.

name: paperboy_2000
text: 1924 Birth Certificate Instructions: Line 4 - Gender, Check M or F. If M, proceed to Line 5. If F, skip ahead to line 22.

name: ethelthefrog
text: A comment left by ethelthefrog was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by GMM, norm, Ikrizzle, peterjoel)

name: elgranchaco
text: nothing worse than being stricken with dolphin lung.

name: honesttom
text: The death of Vladimir Lenin was very much the in thing that year. People would hold theme parties and such. Guy would dress up, halfway through he'd groan, clutch his head and fall to the ground.

name: scraggg
text: And then he would be entombed and put on display for decades.

name: mystkmanat
text: Next a man from Georgia would take over as host of the party; he would proceed to make a pact with Hitler and then kill all guests.

name: aelindil
text: Rough chuckles.

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
SOON:
The rise and fall of the Ccommunist Revolution and Soviet Union by Roomba Theater.

name: jackparsons
text: Are there any non-Caucasians in Reminisce magazine? Do they have weird articles like Readers' Digest's "I Am Joe's Man Gland"?

name: soticoto
text: I am Jack's raging bile duct.

name: tekende
text: I Am Sheryl's Osteoperosis

name: alzuna
text:
I read that article (or the one similarly titled) and it was scary as hell.

HELL.

name: tripperday
text: I Am Alzuna's Heebie Jeebies.

name: stuart
text: Note that this implies Roast Beef reads this magazine regularly.

name: relaxing
text: It's the only readin' available on Gramma K's crapper.

name: killingthejay
text: that was a misclick i totally mean to chubby that.  i am sorry.

name: relaxing
text: HUGS!

name: nicolae
text: Ray's confusion is like delicious sauce for dippin'

name: dukieshane
text: This is so awesome. It reminds me of the strip when Beef sells cheeseburgers to the religious nuts.

name: overmedicated
text: Sammiches!

name: norm
text: The Orson Welles poll not only has the bars labeled with bold, capital letters, but it has a key as well.  It would be tragic to misread that poll, I suppose.  Precautions have been taken.

name: zorglemeister
text: The key makes the chart, I feel.  Most excellent.

name: hypoluxa
text:
Ray's utter lack of understanding makes this for me.

And Dolphin Lung sounds like it would be a great ability to possess.


Go figure.

name: latterman
text: Oh man. Does anyone else see parallels between Milklin Honniker and Jim Jones?

name: cpnglxynchos
text: yeah...but in a way that's hard to care about anymore.

name: cailetshadow
text:
The information in this magazine rolls off the surface of Ray's eyeballs like water off of a duck.

He will not be subscribing.

name: jhunter
text:
I read that as water off a dick and I have got some graphic images roaring through my subconscious like a runaway freight with a twisted sentience of its very own.

Also, I would stab a baby to be called Aloysius.
ah-loo-ish-us

name: cagliostro
text: Was the water running off it in wonderful ad hoc rivulets?

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Roast Beef: Car registration fees due again
Pat: Computer Software.
Mr. Bear: A terrible bit of angling!

name: alzuna
text: I want to know what the lace up arm thing is...Some sort of ridiculous cure for Summer Complaint perhaps?

name: dickie_roxx
text: I believe it's some sort of olde-time prosthesis.  Observe the articulation at the elbow and the fully-sculpted hand.  The sort of prosthesis that you wear after you got your arm blown off in The War, not because it does you any personal good (e.g. no motor control of the hand), but for the comfort of your neighbors so they don't have to look at your armlessness all the day long.

name: mustakrakesh
text: I'm just glad I don't have the Dolphin Lung!

name: genocidefish
text: Funniest line in this comic: data not recorded.

name: king-jim
text: The close-up of Beef's nasty broken claw is a nice touch.

name: jimmyk
text: The best thing is how Ray comes back to what. "What? How? Why? What?" Priceless :D

name: tekende
text: I think Karl Webber is disappointed at the number of brothers he lost during the War. He had hoped to be an only child by the time the War was over.

name: gelter
text: Who? What? What? How? Why? What? Who? What? What? Huh? I don't get it.

name: duperando
text:
I must love you 'Cause I sure don't like you, Marieeee,
I do declare that that's the only way it could beeeee

name: thebeans
text: Hahaha. This alt text is the best ever.

name: alilsneaky
text: 'Only two' brothers, that is harsh man.

name: dweener
text: Spokane! Thats where i am from! I love you Doris!

text: god why would you be from spokane that is terrible it is just awful
